verses.verse: The song<WH7892> of songs<WH7892>, which is Solomon's<WH8010>.
Let him kiss<WH5401> me with the kisses<WH5390> of his mouth<WH6310>: for thy love<WH1730> is better<WH2896> than wine<WH3196>.
Because of the savour<WH7381> of thy good<WH2896> ointments<WH8081> thy name<WH8034> is as ointment<WH8081> poured forth<WH7324>, therefore do the virgins<WH5959> love<WH157> thee.

Draw<WH4900> me, we will run<WH7323> after<WH310> thee: the king<WH4428> hath brought<WH935> me into his chambers<WH2315>: we will be glad<WH1523> and rejoice<WH8055> in thee, we will remember<WH2142> thy love<WH1730> more than wine<WH3196>: the upright<WH4339> love<WH157> thee.
I am black<WH7838>, but comely<WH5000>, O ye daughters<WH1323> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, as the tents<WH168> of Kedar<WH6938>, as the curtains<WH3407> of Solomon<WH8010>.

Look<WH7200> not upon me, because I am black<WH7840>, because the sun<WH8121> hath looked<WH7805> upon me: my mother's<WH517> children<WH1121> were angry<WH2787> with me; they made<WH7760> me the keeper<WH5201> of the vineyards<WH3754>; but mine own vineyard<WH3754> have I not kept<WH5201>.

Tell<WH5046> me, O thou whom my soul<WH5315> loveth<WH157>, where thou feedest<WH7462>, where<WH349> thou makest thy flock to rest<WH7257> at noon<WH6672>: for<WH4100> why should I be as one that turneth aside<WH5844> by the flocks<WH5739> of thy companions<WH2270>?

¶ If thou know<WH3045> not, O thou fairest<WH3303> among women<WH802>, go thy way forth<WH3318> by the footsteps<WH6119> of the flock<WH6629>, and feed<WH7462> thy kids<WH1429> beside the shepherds'<WH7462> tents<WH4908>.
I have compared<WH1819> thee, O my love<WH7474>, to a company of horses<WH5484> in Pharaoh's<WH6547> chariots<WH7393>.
Thy cheeks<WH3895> are comely<WH4998> with rows<WH8447> of jewels, thy neck<WH6677> with chains<WH2737> of gold.
We will make<WH6213> thee borders<WH8447> of gold<WH2091> with studs<WH5351> of silver<WH3701>.
¶ While the king<WH4428> sitteth at his table<WH4524>, my spikenard<WH5373> sendeth forth<WH5414> the smell<WH7381> thereof.
A bundle<WH6872> of myrrh<WH4753> is my wellbeloved<WH1730> unto me; he shall lie<WH3885> all night betwixt my breasts<WH7699>.
My beloved<WH1730> is unto me as a cluster<WH811> of camphire<WH3724> in the vineyards<WH3754> of En-gedi<WH5872>.
Behold, thou art fair<WH3303>, my love<WH7474>; behold, thou art fair<WH3303>; thou hast doves'<WH3123> eyes<WH5869>.
Behold, thou art fair<WH3303>, my beloved<WH1730>, yea, pleasant<WH5273>: also our bed<WH6210> is green<WH7488>.
The beams<WH6982> of our house<WH1004> are cedar<WH730>, and our rafters<WH7351><WH7351> of fir<WH1266>.
